section.title: Spacewalk 2.1 installation
section.para: In we showed how to install a KMV guest on the host. We reuse the same method for the Fedora 20 guest, on which we run Spacewalk 2.1.

What will be different from the test KVM quest system, is the storage. We will use 3 disks. So, the other 2 disks, coming from vg_slow LVM volume group, must still be added to the KVM guest. This is done via the GUI application virt-manager.

Now, when we boot the KVM guest, we see extra disks:
&sw1p; ls /dev/vd* /dev/vda /dev/vda1 /dev/vda2 /dev/vdb /dev/vdc &sw1p; mkfs.ext4 /dev/vdb mke2fs 1.42.8 (20-Jun-2013) Filesystem label= OS type: Linux Block size=4096 (log=2) Fragment size=4096 (log=2) Stride=0 blocks, Stripe width=0 blocks 960992 inodes, 3840000 blocks 192000 blocks (5.00%) reserved for the super user First data block=0 Maximum filesystem blocks=3934257152 118 block groups 32768 blocks per group, 32768 fragments per group 8144 inodes per group Superblock backups stored on blocks: 32768, 98304, 163840, 229376, 294912, 819200, 884736, 1605632, 2654208
Allocating group tables: done Writing inode tables: done Creating journal (32768 blocks): done Writing superblocks and filesystem accounting information: done &sw1p; mkfs.ext4 /dev/vdc mke2fs 1.42.8 (20-Jun-2013) Filesystem label= OS type: Linux Block size=4096 (log=2) Fragment size=4096 (log=2) Stride=0 blocks, Stripe width=0 blocks 7684096 inodes, 30720000 blocks 1536000 blocks (5.00%) reserved for the super user First data block=0 Maximum filesystem blocks=4294967296 938 block groups 32768 blocks per group, 32768 fragments per group 8192 inodes per group Superblock backups stored on blocks: 32768, 98304, 163840, 229376, 294912, 819200, 884736, 1605632, 2654208, 4096000, 7962624, 11239424, 20480000, 23887872
Allocating group tables: done Writing inode tables: done Creating journal (32768 blocks): done Writing superblocks and filesystem accounting information: done

The basic setup of the guest is now finished. We still want to make sure that we run with the latest RPM set:
&sw1p; yum update .. skipped lines .. Total download size: 116 M Is this ok [y/d/N]: y .. skipped lines .. Retrieving key from file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-fedora-20-x86_64 Importing GPG key 0x246110C1: Userid : "Fedora (20) <fedora@fedoraproject.org>" Fingerprint: c7c9 a9c8 9153 f201 83ce 7cba 2eb1 61fa 2461 10c1 Package : fedora-release-20-1.noarch (@anaconda) From : /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-fedora-20-x86_64 Is this ok [y/N]: y .. skipped lines .. &sw1p; reboot .. to load new kernel ..

We have a problem with firewalld on the host. It blocks the returning DNS traffic from the KVM guest towards the Internet. We have solved it by doing:
&hostp; cat /etc/firewalld/direct.xml <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <direct> [ <rule ipv="ipv4" table="filter" chain="FORWARD_direct" priority="0"> -i br0 -j ACCEPT </rule> ] </direct> &hostp; firewall-cmd reload

We use the information from . The first step is to make the Spacewalk 2.1 yum repository available to our guest KVM:
&sw1p; rpm -Uvh http://yum.spacewalkproject.org/2.1/Fedora/20/x86_64/spacewalk-repo-2.1-2.fc20.noarch.rpm Retrieving http://yum.spacewalkproject.org/2.1/Fedora/20/x86_64/spacewalk-repo-2.1-2.fc20.noarch.rpm warning: /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.PLpkV8: Header V3 DSA/SHA1 Signature, key ID 863a853d: NOKEY Preparing... ################################# [100%] Updating / installing... 1:spacewalk-repo-2.1-2.fc20 ################################# [100%]
Next, we make to make the Java packages, jpackage, yum repository available:
cat > /etc/yum.repos.d/jpackage-generic.repo << EOF [jpackage-generic] name=JPackage generic #baseurl=http://mirrors.dotsrc.org/pub/jpackage/5.0/generic/free/ mirrorlist=http://www.jpackage.org/mirrorlist.php?dist=generic&type=free&release=5.0 enabled=1 gpgcheck=1 gpgkey=http://www.jpackage.org/jpackage.asc EOF
We need to put filesystems on the newly added disks:
&sw1p; parted /dev/vda print devices /dev/vda (5243MB) /dev/mapper/fedora_sw21-swap (524MB) /dev/mapper/fedora_sw21-root (4190MB) /dev/vdb (15.7GB) /dev/vdc (126GB)
&sw1p; grep vd[bc] /etc/fstab /dev/vdb /var/lib/pgsql ext4 defaults 0 0 /dev/vdc /var/satellite ext4 defaults 0 0
&sw1p; mkdir -p /var/satellite /var/lib/pgsql
&sw1p; mount -a
&sw1p; yum install spacewalk-setup-postgresql jpackage-generic | 1.9 kB 00:00 spacewalk | 2.1 kB 00:00 (1/3): spacewalk/20/x86_64/group | 11 kB 00:00 (2/3): spacewalk/20/x86_64/primary_db | 135 kB
